, there are few matters that US soldiers would rather forget than the pictures of a hooded Iraqi man standing with his hands outstretched and wires attached. according to the Washington Post, Donald Rumsfeld remains largely unapologetic. In a lengthy section on the administration's treatment of wartime detainees, Donald Rumsfeld regrets not leaving office in May 2004 after the disclosure of the Abu Ghraib prison scandal, writes reviewer Bradley Graham.
